body_html: @jackyko1991 The instruction is quite different when you try to build for python 2.7, because mingw is used instead of visual c++. Anyway, you can use the build which is uploaded to Google Drive. You can gain access from this link. However, due to lack of support for nvcc with mingw compiler, the 2.7 package is CPU-only.
body_text: @jackyko1991 The instruction is quite different when you try to build for python 2.7, because mingw is used instead of visual c++. Anyway, you can use the build which is uploaded to Google Drive. You can gain access from this link. However, due to lack of support for nvcc with mingw compiler, the 2.7 package is CPU-only.
body: @jackyko1991 The instruction is quite different when you try to build for python 2.7, because mingw is used instead of visual c++. Anyway, you can use the build which is uploaded to Google Drive. You can gain access from this [link](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B-X0-FlSGfCYdTNldW02UGl4MXM?usp=sharing). However, due to lack of support for nvcc with mingw compiler, the 2.7 package is CPU-only.
